documents.title: PRD: Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HelloFresh Group
documents.content:
ÔªøSummary

 `

Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HF Groups Customers

	Summary: One-time-purchases enable HelloFresh to address customer needs for order flexibility, accessibility and concerns around subscription commitment, while enabling new ways to engage with existing, new and past customers across a variety of different use cases. This PRD aims to consolidate all known use cases for OTP in 2025 for HFG to define a path forward towards implementation.

	Created At: Jun 2, 2025

	Last Updated: Jul 7, 2025

	Editor(s): Deo Nathaniel ‚Äì POC & Workflow

	Strategy: 

Seasonal boxes and one-off ordering capability 2024 & beyond proposalCross-Selling: Enable HF US customers to purchase single order(s) or recurring Factor meals through a ‚ÄúMarket Integration‚Äù experienceNV-2025-01: Good Chop: Move Towards Ecommerce ExperienceTwo-Way Marketplace: (Dropshipping Expansion) Leadership Steerco

	BC:  TBD

	Disclaimer: Some of the content, documents or research provided in this document might be generated by AI.

	



[HOW TO READ] This document is structured based on three big parts:

1. Summary & High-Level Overview Tab: These tabs serve as the central strategic hub. It outlines context and brief customer flows for each major use case (e.g., Good Chop, Seasonal Boxes) to give a quick understanding of the customer journey. It also synthesizes the Key Functionalities that need to be built across all these different use cases.

2. Individual Use Case Tabs (e.g., "Experience - Good Chop", "Experience - Seasonal Boxes"): Each of these dedicated tabs dives deep into a specific product or initiative. They break down the requirements by Milestones (e.g., MVP - Milestone 1), providing a clear roadmap from a use case perspective. The requirements are listed with User Stories and Acceptance Criteria format.

3. Dependency Tab: These tabs are used to identify and detail any specific work or information required from dependent Tribes and alliances.

1. Summary View of the Solution Proposed

This initiative aims to deliver a One-Time-Purchase (OTP) capability experience across HelloFresh Group brands. As of June 2025, across HelloFresh, several use cases had been identified‚Äîsuch as event-themed seasonal boxes, curated selections of specialized items (e.g., premium meat and seafood from Good Chop), items from a broader marketplace of third-party CPG brands, or ready-to-eat meals from sister brands like Factor‚Äîas standalone purchases, without the necessity of an active weekly meal kit subscription for that particular transaction (though OTP may also complement existing subscriptions).

The solution involves creating a seamless OTP user flow within each participating brand's digital platform. This includes clear product discovery for OTP-eligible items, transparent pricing and benefits, distinct OTP cart[a] and checkout processes, appropriate order management for both new and existing customers (subscribed, paused, or cancelled), and downstream capabilities such as delivery management and data.

This foundational OTP capability will initially be piloted and rolled out for:

1. 2025 Initiative Rollouts: 

   1. Seasonal Boxes across HelloFresh (similar to the ANZ model but integrated).

   2. Good Chop offerings for both prospects and actives.

   3. Factor Form item based OTP purchase

2. 2026 Potential Targets:

   1. A 2-Way Marketplace on a selected HelloFresh brand (e.g., Green Chef US pilot) (potential PoC in Q4 2025) 

   2. Cross-selling of Factor meals (as OTP) (iteration on the ‚ÄúOpt-in‚Äù Market Integration Model)

   3. Further discovery m



create add-on menus, call another menu, etc. if we don't have to.

[by]What about the other way around? Are we expecting an ability to use existing benefits (through loyalty program) for the seasonal boxes?

[bz]What does it actually mean? Can you drop an example?

[ca]wondering the same - @nathaniel.deo@hellofresh.com what did you have in mind?

[cb]@mabu@hellofresh.com lmk if this is clearer now @nathaniel.deo@hellofresh.com

[cc]What's "GST charge"?

[cd]Goods and Service Fee - NZ is set at 15% and is normally baked into products sold and AU is 10% but there are different rules to consider in order to remain compliant.

[ce]Assuming this would be a separate payment for customers who may also be ordering a regular subscription box? Similarly to how we charge HFM currently?

[cf]Payment details are never stored in the HF system, hence, it is not possible to prefill payment details. What we can try doing is "use existing payment" which would be a reference to a payment token.

[cg]What do we mean by this?

[ch]@nathaniel.deo@hellofresh.com i assume you mean all the payment methods?

[ci]Does it mean that the data of OTP should be a part of analytics and should be identifiable as OTP?

[cj]essential to note that customers who have already purchased a seasonal box to be excluded from future CRM emails (i.e. if someone bought a Christmas box at full price, should not get a Black Friday discount email)

[ck]check if this breaks given there are not recipes essentially.

[cl]How will errors and NPS be measured?

[cm]check for Taxes

[cn]ask Daniel

[co]Check with Benefits if they need subscription ID

[cp]@mabu@hellofresh.com

[cq]Check on Invoice

[cr]@mabu@hellofresh.com to check

[cs]Check if account, delivery and payment information can be prefilled

[ct]Ask Leo

[cu]I think we can simplify this to just talk about Katana

[cv]Split between FE data and BE data

[cw]@mabu@hellofresh.com to help check

[cx]Forecasting? Or will we rely on business case assumptions to plan volumes. Concern here is waste and ordering accuracy.

[cy]Will we have individual landing pages per seasonal offering or a page for "gifting" and a page for "seasonal boxes" which has all current boxes. (ref point https://www.myfoodbag.co.nz/shop/)

[cz]what's the difference between a guest checkout and a normal checkout?

[da]what's the difference between a guest checkout and a normal checkout?

documents.title: DRAFT - Good Chop - Shopify Storefront
documents.content:
Ôªøüöß Overview





Good Chop - Shopify Storefront

	Created At: Oct 27, 2025

	Last Updated: Nov 12, 2025

	Status: In Progress

	Author: Alison Ryan

	



Summary

This document outlines the approach and implementation strategy for to experiment with item-based pricing for Good Chop. This experiment will create a Shopify storefront to offer products through both one-time purchases and flexible subscriptions.

The primary objective is to create an new marketplace for Good Chop customers to order products in a flexible way that fit additional needs. With the marketplace, we hope to gain insights into how product uptake, order habits, customer lifetime value, and impact on subscription retention differ than the existing experience. We will also evaluate the operational lift and cost-effectiveness of this new channel.

Strategy Review

Good Chop is launching a new marketplace experience built on Shopify to offer customers flexible ordering, such as one-time purchases and item-based pricing. The test will help us get quick learnings and build confidence on initiatives not easily testable in our current tech infrastructure, such as item-based pricing. Furthermore it will focus on targeting customers entering specific channels (eg via SEM when prospects search for specific cuts).

* Phase 1: Launch with item-based pricing and a traditional e-commerce experience to establish baseline performance metrics. 

* Phase 2: Introduce a "subscriptions + save" option and compare its performance against both OTP and the current subscription model.

* Phase 3: Scope and goals will be determined based on the comprehensive results from Phases 1 and 2.

Implementation will be handled in partnership with an external team (Anatta) ensuring a streamlined and rapid setup of the Shopify marketplace.

Success will be evaluated based on core metrics, including CAC, CVR and AOR. We will also track user journey analysis, CLV and product uptake to identify any performance differences for specific protein cuts in an e-commerce context. The assessment of this new channel will focus on its operational efficiency and cost-effectiveness.









What is the problem we‚Äôre trying to solve?





What is the solution?



Who is the target customer? What will customer experience be?[a]

* The primary focus for this Shopify Storefront is to capture new customers whose profiles align with the established Good Chop customer personas.

* However, the scope is not exclusively limited to entirely new customers. We recognize the value of driving traffic and potential conversions from a broader audience. Therefore, we will not restrict access or promotional offers to customers who may already have an existing account, a currently active subscription, or a past subscription history with Good Chop.

* The strategy is to leverage the new storefront experience to:

1. Acquire New Customers: Specifically target individuals identified by our marketing segmentation as being an ideal fit for the Good Chop brand and product offering.

2. Re-engage Former/Existing Customers: Allow existing or previous subscribers to easily interact with the new storefront, potentially leading to new, additional, or reactivated subscriptions.

This inclusive approach ensures we maximize the reach and impact of the new Shopify storefront across the entire potential customer spectrum while remaining focused on the core objective of new customer acquisition.





Customers have the ability to maintain their current account / subscrtioins experience today, as well as explore and order from the Shopfiy marketplace. 



sting Factor Customers)

* Primary Focus: Synergy & Convenience.

   * Tone: Familiar, convenient, value-add, and focused on integration with existing routines.

   * Core Message: Complete your routine. Factor Form supplements are designed to perfectly complement your weekly Factor meals and optimize your wellness goals.

   * Key Value Props: "Add to your existing subscription," "Checkout in one click," "Formulated to pair with our meal plans."

C. Brand Alignment

The visual identity (logos, colors, fonts) must be identical across both platforms to maintain a single, cohesive Factor Form brand, regardless of the user's entry point. The only distinction should be the functionality and the audience-specific messaging.





4. Data Strategy

The goal is to establish a single, unified source of truth for Factor Form performance data while avoiding direct integration with existing HelloFresh dashboards to minimize integration complexity and alignment overhead.

Data type 

	Approach

	Financial performance

	 Will be aggregated manually (by downloading Shopify reports and summing them with Factor data).

	Usage tracking

	For MVP, we will support a simple GTM install. More advanced usage tracking will be done directly on Shopify or Shopify plugins

	Experimentation

	No integration with Statsig. Any A/B test will be run and analyzed directly on Shopify or Shopify plugins

	User feedback

	Since HelloFresh uses Sprig but Sprig is not on Shopify, any customer feedback needs will be managed directly on Shopify or through Shopify plugins

	Product ratings and reviews

	Handled through 3rd party Shopify plugin, yotpo.com 

	











[a]@sameer.doda@hellofresh.ca this whole section was written oct, when we yet aligned on excluding traffic between sites. We will need to edit, to reflect out recommendation to exclude or not. 





This is a open question for Yury to decide on, so we need to showcase both options.

[b]We dont have a STRICT timeline

We want to go live in Q1

Launch in March, to get insights before Q2

At Minimum 2 weeks, for campaigns to have an insight into performance

[c]not sure how this works or what we use for GoodChop today...

[d]elevar?

[e]will need alignment with Nikita

[f]pulled from email with Nikita. Needs work / clarity.

[g]Will need support from Yury / team to confirm this

[h]TBD with alignment from Yury / team

[i]this maintains?
